title: Harriet Tubman Underground Railroad National Historical Park: Park Home
body: A Life Dedicated to God and Freedom  Harriet Tubman was a deeply spiritual woman who lived her ideals and dedicated her life to freedom. She is the Underground Railroad’s best known conductor and in the decades before the Civil War, repeatedly risked her life to guide nearly 70 enslaved people to new lives of freedom in the North.Tubman would recognize the landscapes protected in this new national monument on Maryland’s Eastern Shore              Plan Your Visit   Learn what to do and where to go when you visit!
